message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.SI

This paper is about semi-supervised classification and active learning, which are both topics in machine learning. The paper also mentions Bayesian classification models, which are commonly studied in the subfield of probabilistic machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also uses information-theoretic bounds, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory). Additionally, the paper mentions computer vision (cs.CV) as a potential application area for the proposed methods, and social impact (cs.SI) may also be relevant given the potential benefits of more efficient and accurate classification algorithms.
